==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
Originally the same character as {{och-l|乎}}. The oracle bone form consists of {{zh-l|*丂|fork in a tree}} and two vertical strokes above; the two strokes are parallel in most oracle bone attestations, possibly representing finer branches (i.e. the sound produced by wind blows past these branches).
